author: kolbyml
content: Is there a channel (or breakout room) for discussing stateless EL clients? Because I think it would make sense for stateless EL clients to use the Portal State network.

author: rjected
content: why? the active state would be distributed along with payloads / blocks right?

author: kolbyml
content: Oh is that the case? I guess this is a sign I need to do more research into what the plan is for stateless EL clients

author: rjected
content: My understanding is that a stateless client consumes "richer" blocks and payloads, for example a non-stateless client can execute without active state / witnesses. But a stateless client needs to be sent the active state for the range they are executing, along with proofs that the state being sent is included in the global state (merkle/verkle proofs)

author: rjected
content: Block builders could include even more useful metadata along with proofs, such as execution or caching schedules
